clusters.title: Arrests over alleged $1.4 million bank card fraud
clusters.neutral_headline: Arrests Made in Alleged Bank Card Fraud Scheme

items.title: Arrests over alleged $1.4 million bank card fraud
items.standfirst: Police have charged three people in Sydney for allegedly stealing bank cards and supplying them to organised crime networks.
items.content: Police have charged three people in Sydney for allegedly stealing bank cards and supplying them to organised crime networks.

items.title: Sydney postal worker charged over $1.4 million stolen bank card scheme
items.standfirst: T hree men have been charged so far over a scheme to steal bank cards from mail services to supply to crime groups.
items.content: Three men, including a postal worker, have been charged with stealing bank cards from a mail delivery network and supplying them to organised crime members in Sydney.Police allege a 56-year-old postal worker stole the cards from the mail in Edgecliff, Woollahra, and Double Bay, in Sydney's east.Investigators also claim he was involved in supplying the cards to two separate organised crime syndicates in Rockdale.READ MORE: 'Total victory': Trump hails $820 million court winPolice claim the cards were used for more than $1.4 million worth of fraud.From about 4am on Wednesday, police executed five search warrants in Rockdale and Roselands. They allegedly seized more than $14,000 in cash, an encrypted communications device, stolen bank cards, a Taser, and luxury items such as a watch, handbags, and jewellery.READ MORE: Millions facing days of flood risks as torrential rain eases At a Rockdale address, police arrested a 56-year-old man.He was charged with 143 fraud-related offences.At another Rockdale address, police arrested a 35-year-old man who was charged with fraud-related and other offences.READ MORE: CCTV shows violent attack on one of NSW's most notorious prisonersIn Roselands, police arrested a 27-year-old man and charged with multiple fraud offences.All three were refused bail and appeared in court yesterday.The investigation is ongoing, with more arrests and charges expected.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: Police charged three people in Sydney.
They allegedly stole bank cards and supplied them to crime networks.
The scheme involved stealing bank cards from mail services.
